title: Smooth Spaces 3: Map Spaces, Calculus, and Dynamics

media:group.media:title: Smooth Spaces 3: Map Spaces, Calculus, and Dynamics
media:group.media:description:
In this video I introduce map spaces and functionals, and describe their applications in physics. I also describe how differentiation, integration, and vector fields can be described using infinitesimals, a new view of the continuum based on infinitesimals, and how we can connect infinitesimals, map spaces, and vector fields with the standard study of continuous dynamical systems via differential equations. This approach is illustrated by looking at how to solve the harmonic oscillator system from physics.

A lot of this content was inspired by Lawvere's paper

https://github.com/mattearnshaw/lawvere/blob/master/pdfs/2017-everyday-physics-of-extended-bodies-or-why-functionals-need-analyzing.pdf

And by Bell's book `A primer of infinitesimal Analysis'

A rigorous approach to this subject, emphasizing the category theoretic foundations, can be found here:

Category Theory For Beginners: Synthetic Differential Geometry
https://youtu.be/y9ieJ1Gpl6Y
